An Introvert's Guide To Diwali In 13 Easy Steps (You Can Thank Us Later)

An Introvert's Guide To Diwali In 13 Easy Steps (You Can Thank Us Later)

Introverts are different. Studies have found that they are the people with low dopamine threshold. They like their own company more than anyone else's.

However, October--the month of festivals--can pose quite the challenge for them. There are countless parties happening and there's almost always a knock on the door.

This is where introverts get stuck, one can say. That's exactly why we prepare this special Diwali guide for introvert's so you can enjoy the festivities and your own company.

1. Going to a Diwali party? Take at least two friends you are close to along.

Pinterest

2. Wear something so extraordinary that people feel intimidated to talk to you.

Instagram

3. Your safest bet is playing a card game. There's hardly any conversation.

Instagram

4. Always have a glass of your choice of drink so people take you to be drunk.

Instagram

5. Keep a Diwali party at your home where you feel the most comfortable.

Instagram

6. Get drunk and dance with your eyes closed.

Instagram

7. Stuff your mouth with sweets anytime someone approaches you. It's the best conversation-killer.

Instagram

8. Light a diya, find a corner on the balcony of your house and stay there all evening.

Instagram

9. Ignore the adults. Help the children light (green) firecrackers.

Instagram

10. Give amazing gifts to everyone and make them feel special.

Instagram





11. Protect your dog on Diwali.

Instagram

12. Hang out with family and play tombola.

Instgram

13. Or just sleep throughout the day pretending to be sick.
